summary: Purvesh Rathod is a technically proficient Backend Engineer candidate with 3+ years of experience, strong programming skills in Python, Java, and JavaScript, and solid cloud infrastructure knowledge (AWS certified). He demonstrates strong fundamentals in API design (REST/GraphQL), distributed systems concepts, and modern DevOps practices. His Master's degree from Dalhousie University and diverse project portfolio show promise. However, he presents as a MODERATE FIT for a senior backend engineering role due to gaps in critical areas: limited demonstrated experience designing large-scale production distributed systems (role requires 2+ years), no clear track record of mentoring junior engineers, and insufficient evidence of cross-functional collaboration. His experience appears more mid-level than senior, with projects leaning academic rather than production-scale. He would be an excellent candidate for a Backend Engineer II (mid-level) position or could be considered for the senior role if the hiring team has strong mentorship capacity to develop his leadership capabilities.
key_points: Meets baseline technical requirements: 3+ years of production coding experience with Python and Java proficiency
AWS Certified Developer with hands-on experience across multiple cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Strong full-stack capabilities with demonstrated REST API and GraphQL implementation experience
Comprehensive modern tech stack knowledge: Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, multiple databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis)
Recent Master's degree in Applied Computer Science demonstrates current knowledge and learning commitment
Self-directed learner with entrepreneurial spirit and active GitHub profile (41 repositories)
Critical gap: Limited evidence of designing large-scale distributed systems (2+ years required for role)
Critical gap: No demonstrated track record of mentoring junior engineers
Limited evidence of cross-functional collaboration with product managers and designers
No experience with preferred language Golang or protocols like gRPC/Thrift
Portfolio projects (Chatify, Cloud Kitchen, Eventify) appear more academic than production-scale
Recent graduate status suggests limited senior-level experience in fast-paced production environments
recommendations: Recommend considering candidate for Backend Engineer II (mid-level) role instead of senior position based on experience level and demonstrated capabilities
If proceeding with senior Backend Engineer role, ensure hiring team has bandwidth to provide close mentorship and leadership development support
Conduct in-depth technical phone screen focusing on distributed systems architecture, scalability challenges, and production system design experience
Request specific examples and metrics from production systems he has designed, scaled, or significantly contributed to
Assess depth of Python and Java expertise through live coding assessment with focus on API design, data structures, and system architecture
Evaluate cultural fit for fast-paced environment through behavioral questions about handling ambiguity, shipping under pressure, and making trade-offs
Probe collaboration experience with specific questions about working with product managers, designers, and frontend engineers
Discuss mentoring philosophy and assess willingness to develop mentorship skills if this is a growth area
Evaluate learning agility by discussing approach to learning Golang and gRPC/Thrift protocols
Verify AWS hands-on experience beyond certification through architectural discussions of complex cloud implementations
Consider a trial project or extended technical interview to assess real-world problem-solving and code quality
If gaps are concerning, create a structured 90-day onboarding plan with clear milestones for developing distributed systems expertise and leadership skills
name: Purvesh Rathod
education: Master of Science in Applied Computer Science from Dalhousie University
strengths: Meets the required 3+ years of production coding experience with clean, maintainable code
Strong proficiency in object-oriented programming languages (Python, Java) as required
Demonstrated experience with API design including REST and GraphQL protocols
AWS certified with hands-on cloud computing experience (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with distributed systems and serverless architecture through multiple projects (Chatify, Cloud Kitchen, Eventify)
Full-stack capabilities with backend focus - understands both frontend and backend integration
Strong DevOps knowledge including Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD practices
Experience with modern tech stack including Kafka, ElasticSearch, and various databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis)
Self-directed learner with entrepreneurial spirit - continuously learning new technologies
Portfolio demonstrates passion for building scalable applications and solving complex problems
Experience as Cloud Engineer intern at DeepSense developing AWS-based solutions
Active GitHub profile with 41 repositories showing hands-on development practice
Strong educational background with recent Master's degree in Computer Science
weaknesses: Limited explicit evidence of mentoring junior engineers - role requires track record of mentoring
No clear demonstration of experience designing large-scale distributed systems (2+ years required)
Limited evidence of working in cross-functional teams with product and design
No direct mention of experience with Golang which is listed as a preferred language
No explicit evidence of experience with Thrift or gRPC protocols
Limited information about leadership roles or strategic planning contributions
Recent graduate status suggests most experience may be academic or entry-mid level rather than senior
No clear evidence of working in fast-paced startup or social media platform environments like Reddit
Portfolio projects appear to be individual/academic rather than production systems at scale
Limited evidence of participating in code reviews or contributing to developer workflow improvements
overall_fit: MODERATE FIT - Purvesh Rathod demonstrates strong technical fundamentals with 3+ years of experience and proficiency in Python and Java, meeting the baseline technical requirements. His AWS certification, cloud infrastructure knowledge, and experience with REST/GraphQL APIs align well with the role. However, there are significant gaps in critical areas: he lacks demonstrated experience designing large-scale distributed systems (required 2+ years), no clear track record of mentoring junior engineers, and limited evidence of working in cross-functional team environments. His portfolio shows promising full-stack capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit, but projects appear more academic than production-scale. While his technical skills are solid, the role requires a more seasoned backend engineer with proven leadership, mentoring experience, and large-scale systems design background. He would be better suited for a mid-level backend role or could be considered if the team has strong mentorship capacity to develop his leadership skills.
suggested_next_steps: Conduct technical phone screen to assess depth of distributed systems knowledge and Python/Java expertise
Request specific examples of production systems designed and scaled, with focus on architecture decisions
Assess experience with cross-functional collaboration through behavioral interview questions
Evaluate code quality and testing practices through technical coding assessment focusing on backend design
Discuss mentoring philosophy and any informal mentoring experiences
Explore willingness to learn Golang if selected (Python/Java strong, but Golang preferred)
Verify hands-on experience with gRPC/Thrift protocols or assess learning capacity
Evaluate cultural fit regarding fast-paced environment, ambiguity tolerance, and bias for action
Consider for Backend Engineer II role (mid-level) instead of senior position, or
If proceeding with Backend Engineer role, ensure team has capacity to support leadership development and provide close mentorship initially
common_questions: Tell me about your experience designing and implementing REST and GraphQL APIs. What architectural decisions did you make and why?
Describe a distributed system you've built or worked on. What were the key challenges and how did you address scalability, consistency, and fault tolerance?
Walk me through your experience with AWS services. What specific services have you used in production, and can you describe a complex AWS architecture you've implemented?
Explain your approach to writing clean, maintainable code. How do you ensure code quality in your projects?
Tell me about your experience with microservices architecture. What frameworks and tools have you used, and what patterns have you implemented?
Describe a time when you had to optimize a system for performance. What was your approach and what were the results?
How do you approach database design and selection? Walk me through a project where you chose between SQL and NoSQL databases.
Tell me about your experience with message queuing systems like Kafka. What use cases have you implemented and what challenges did you face?
Describe your experience working with Docker and Kubernetes. How have you used containerization in your projects?
Have you mentored or guided other developers? If so, describe your approach. If not, how would you approach mentoring a junior engineer?
Tell me about a time when you collaborated with product managers, designers, or frontend engineers. How did you ensure effective communication and alignment?
Describe a challenging technical problem you solved. What was your thought process and how did you arrive at the solution?
How do you stay current with new technologies and best practices? Give examples of recent technologies you've learned.
Tell me about your experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices. What tools have you used and what processes have you implemented?
Describe your testing strategy. How do you approach unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing?
Walk me through your experience with the Chatify, Cloud Kitchen, or Eventify projects. What were the technical challenges and your specific contributions?
How do you handle working in a fast-paced environment with ambiguous requirements? Give me a specific example.
Tell me about a time when you had to make a trade-off between perfect code and shipping quickly. How did you decide?
What is your experience with monitoring, logging, and observability? What tools have you used and how do you approach system reliability?
Are you familiar with Golang? If not, how quickly do you typically learn new programming languages, and what's your approach?
Describe your experience with gRPC or Thrift protocols. If limited, how would you approach learning these technologies?
Tell me about a time when you received critical feedback on your code. How did you respond and what did you learn?
How do you approach code reviews? What do you look for when reviewing others' code?
Describe a situation where you had to debug a production issue. What was your process and how did you resolve it?
What attracts you to working on large-scale distributed systems? Where do you see your career growth in the next 2-3 years?
best_practices: Review the STAR method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) for answering behavioral questions with concrete examples from your experience
Prepare 3-5 detailed project stories that demonstrate your technical depth, problem-solving abilities, and collaboration skills
Be ready to discuss architectural diagrams - practice drawing system designs for your major projects (Chatify, Cloud Kitchen, Eventify)
Refresh your knowledge of distributed systems concepts: CAP theorem, consistency models, partitioning strategies, load balancing, and caching
Review AWS services you've used in depth, especially those relevant to backend development (EC2, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, S3, API Gateway, SQS/SNS)
Prepare specific metrics and outcomes from your projects - demonstrate impact with numbers when possible
Practice explaining complex technical concepts in simple terms to demonstrate communication skills for cross-functional collaboration
Be honest about areas where you lack experience (mentoring, Golang, gRPC/Thrift) but emphasize your learning agility and willingness to grow
Prepare questions about the team structure, mentorship opportunities, and how the company supports engineer growth
Review your GitHub repositories and be ready to walk through code examples, explaining design decisions and trade-offs
Study common design patterns and be prepared to discuss when and why you'd use each one
Refresh your understanding of database indexing, query optimization, and transaction management
Prepare examples that demonstrate your 'bias for action' and ability to work in fast-paced environments
Review your AWS certification materials and be ready to discuss practical applications of cloud architecture
Practice live coding problems focused on backend scenarios: API design, data modeling, algorithms, and system design
Prepare to discuss your approach to testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and test-driven development
Be ready to explain your experience with CI/CD pipelines and how you've implemented automated deployment processes
Review microservices patterns: service discovery, circuit breakers, API gateways, and inter-service communication
Prepare examples of how you've handled technical debt and balanced feature development with code quality
Research the company's tech stack and products thoroughly to ask informed questions and show genuine interest
Practice discussing trade-offs in technical decisions - showing nuanced thinking is crucial for senior roles
Prepare to address the gap in large-scale distributed systems experience by highlighting relevant coursework, personal projects, and learning initiatives
Be ready to discuss your Master's thesis or capstone project in detail if it's relevant to distributed systems or backend engineering
Frame your entrepreneurial spirit and self-directed learning as assets that will help you ramp up quickly and contribute effectively
resources: Book: 'Designing Data-Intensive Applications' by Martin Kleppmann - Essential for distributed systems understanding
Book: 'System Design Interview' by Alex Xu - Comprehensive guide for system design preparation
Online Course: 'Grokking the System Design Interview' on Educative.io - Practice designing scalable systems
Online Course: 'Grokking the Advanced System Design Interview' on Educative.io - Deep dive into distributed systems
Website: AWS Well-Architected Framework documentation - Review best practices for cloud architecture
GitHub: Awesome System Design Resources (github.com/madd86/awesome-system-design) - Curated list of system design resources
YouTube Channel: ByteByteGo - System design concepts explained visually
Website: High Scalability (highscalability.com) - Real-world architecture case studies from major tech companies
Book: 'Clean Code' by Robert C. Martin - Refresh principles for writing maintainable code
Documentation: Go by Example (gobyexample.com) - Quick way to familiarize yourself with Golang basics
Online Platform: LeetCode - Practice backend-focused coding problems (focus on medium/hard difficulty)
Website: Pramp or interviewing.io - Practice mock technical interviews with peers
Documentation: gRPC official documentation - Learn about RPC protocols if this comes up
Article Series: 'The Architecture of Open Source Applications' - Learn from real-world system designs
Podcast: Software Engineering Daily - Stay current with industry trends and technologies
Website: System Design Primer on GitHub (github.com/donnemartin/system-design-primer) - Comprehensive system design study guide
Online Course: 'Microservices Architecture' on Udemy or Coursera - Deepen microservices knowledge
Documentation: Kafka documentation and tutorials - Review streaming architecture concepts
Book: 'Database Internals' by Alex Petrov - Understanding database systems at a deeper level
Website: Reddit Engineering Blog - Learn about the company's technical challenges and solutions
YouTube: InfoQ presentations on distributed systems and microservices
Online Resource: Educative.io courses on REST API design and GraphQL
Practice: Design your previous projects (Chatify, Cloud Kitchen, Eventify) at larger scale on paper to prepare for system design discussions
Documentation: Review Docker and Kubernetes best practices from official documentation
Book: 'The Manager's Path' by Camille Fournier - Chapters on mentoring and technical leadership to prepare for mentorship questions
